page.title: 15ECONOMICS IN M.W./SHIPT.
page.content: As Market Weighton became established as a market town, it became important for local villages and farmers. There are 5 banks in the town: "T.S.B.", "Midland", "Barclays" and "Lloyds". All are widely used by the local people. The banks keep normal banking hours and the "National Giro Bank" keeps Post Office hours. There are also branches of the following Building Societies: "Nationwide", "Halifax", "Leicester" and the "Bradford and Bingley". The "Halifax" is part of "Hornsey and Sons", an estate agents and is used to arrange mortgages for house buyers. Shiptonthorpe has no such economic establishments as it is such a small village, consisting largely of farms. Its proximity to Market Weighton is also a factor.
